intro: Macrotis, commonly known as the silver dollar plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants are characterized by their succulent leaves, which are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. They produce small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, white, and red, typically blooming in spring. Macrotis species are popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
